intro: Mentzelia corumbaensis, commonly known as the Corumbá blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Mentzelia corumbaensis is known for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in supporting local pollinators.
